    • Method Detail

      • coerceUserList

        public static CoercionUtil.Result coerceUserList(java.util.Collection<Expression> expressions,
                                                 ExpressionTypeManager typeManager,
                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SqlType> lambdaTypeMapping)
        Coerce a list of user-supplied expressions.

        User supplied expressions lists, such as those used in a IN [b, c, d] or structured type constructors, can contain literals that need coercing, and expressions that need validating to ensure all conform to a common Sql type.

        For example, the ARRAY constructor, when creating a numeric array, can be called with a combination of different numeric types, and even strings containing numbers, such as: 

        
 ARRAY[10, 11.2, 13.00, '14.1230', column0, expression0]

        ...such a list must have its elements converted to a common type. Where a common type can not be found, an error is thrown. Where found, the common type is the widest type of all expressions in the list. Where widest means:

        • for numeric types: the widest numeric type, e.g BIGINT is wider than INTEGER.
        • for struct types: the super set of all fields.

        Any literal expressions will be coerced to new literals of the common type.

        Any non-literal expressions that don't match the common type, but which can be coerced, will be wrapped in an explicit CAST to convert them to the required type.

        Coercion is performed in order. So the type of the first non-null expression drives the common type. For example, if the first non-null expression is a string, then all other expressions must be coercible to a string. If its numeric, then all other expressions must be coercible to a number, etc.

        Parameters:
        expressions - the expressions to coerce: the order matters!
        typeManager - the type manager used to resolve expression types.
        lambdaTypeMapping - mapping of lambda variables to types.
        Returns:
        the coercion result.
